Package color

Class Colors

java.lang.Object
color.Colors
All Implemented Interfaces:
Category<Color>
public class Colors extends Object implements Category<Color>
Implementation of the generic interface Category instantiated with the class Color.  Provides the tools to create a category in which objects are colors and morphisms between two colors represent the average color. 

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    Colors.Morph
    Implementation of interface Category's generic interface Category.Morphism.  An arrow between two objects, the source and the target.  Morphisms are "processes", the possible ways to get from one value to another.  They can be composed: one can follow a process from an initial value to an intermediate value, and then follow a second process to a final value, and consider the two processes together as a single composite process.
    class 
    Colors.Obj
    Implementation of interface Category's generic interface Category.Object.  Objects are the elements of the category.  If the category is viewed as a directed graph, they correspond to the nodes.  Both in Java and in category theory, objects are members of a collection.  In Java, it is the collection of values associated to a class.

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface categoryBase.Category

    Category.Morphism<S,​T>, Category.Object<O>

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addMorph​(Colors.Morph morph, int id)
    Enables to add a new morphism of type Colors.Morph to the category Colors, provided the morphism and its identification number.  The morphism is added to the category's field morphList, a hash map.
    void
    addObject​(Colors.Obj obj, int id)
    Enables to add a new object of type Colors.Obj to the category Colors, provided the object and its identification number.  The object is added to the category's field objectList, a hash map.
    Category.Morphism<? extends Category.Object<Color>,​? extends Category.Object<Color>>
    compose​(Category.Morphism<? extends Category.Object<Color>,​? extends Category.Object<Color>> f, Category.Morphism<? extends Category.Object<Color>,​? extends Category.Object<Color>> g)
    Composes two adjacent morphisms provided that the source of the second function coincides with the target of the first (that is, their objects match end-to-end). 
    There are two properties that the composition in any category must satisfy:
    - Composition is associative.  If you have three morphisms, f, g, and h, that can be composed, you don't need parentheses to compose them. 
    - For every object A there is an arrow which is a unit of composition.  This arrow loops from the object to itself.  Being a unit of composition means that, when composed with any arrow that either starts at A or ends at A, respectively, it gives back the same arrow.  The unit arrow for object A is called identity on A.
    void
    createCatForImage​(int objNumber, int numberOfConnections)
    Creates a whole new category with a prefixed number of objects and morphisms.
    void
    printDEBUG()
    Prints a string displaying each value of the RGB and YUV triple of the field color of each object of Colors' field objectList, and the identification number of the source and target and a string displaying each value of the RGB and YUV triple of the average color field of each morphism of Colors' field morphList one by one (the values are encapsulated in square brackets and separated by commas).
    void
    saveToFile​(String path)
    Writes in a new line of the file to be saved in the path specified: for every object of Colors' field objectArray: a string displaying each value of the RGB and YUV triple of the field color.  for every morphism of Colors' field morphArray: the identification number of the source and target and a string displaying each value of the RGB and YUV triple of the average color field.  The values are encapsulated in square brackets and separated by commas.
    String
    toString()
    Returns a string displaying each value of the RGB and YUV triple of the field color of each object of Colors' field objectList and of each source and target object of each morphism of Colors' field morphList one by one.  Every value is preceded by the component's name followed by a colon.

    • compose

      public Category.Morphism<? extends Category.Object<Color>,​? extends Category.Object<Color>> compose​(Category.Morphism<? extends Category.Object<Color>,​? extends Category.Object<Color>> f, Category.Morphism<? extends Category.Object<Color>,​? extends Category.Object<Color>> g) throws IllegalCompositionException
      Description copied from interface: Category
      Composes two adjacent morphisms provided that the source of the second function coincides with the target of the first (that is, their objects match end-to-end). 
      There are two properties that the composition in any category must satisfy:
      - Composition is associative.  If you have three morphisms, f, g, and h, that can be composed, you don't need parentheses to compose them. 
      - For every object A there is an arrow which is a unit of composition.  This arrow loops from the object to itself.  Being a unit of composition means that, when composed with any arrow that either starts at A or ends at A, respectively, it gives back the same arrow.  The unit arrow for object A is called identity on A.
      Specified by:
      compose in interface Category<Color>
      Parameters:
      f - the first morphism
      g - the second morphism
      Returns:
      a morphism with starting point in the source of the first morphism and ending point in the target of the second
      Throws:
      IllegalCompositionException - If the source of the second morphism doesn't coincide with the target of the first

    • addObject

      public void addObject​(Colors.Obj obj, int id)
      Enables to add a new object of type Colors.Obj to the category Colors, provided the object and its identification number.  The object is added to the category's field objectList, a hash map.
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to be added to the category's field objectList.
      id - the identification number of the object to be added to the category's field objectList.

    • addMorph

      public void addMorph​(Colors.Morph morph, int id)
      Enables to add a new morphism of type Colors.Morph to the category Colors, provided the morphism and its identification number.  The morphism is added to the category's field morphList, a hash map.
      Parameters:
      morph - the morphism to be added to the category's field morphList.
      id - the identification number of the morphism to be added to the category's field morphList.

    • createCatForImage

      public void createCatForImage​(int objNumber, int numberOfConnections) throws InvalidColorException
      Creates a whole new category with a prefixed number of objects and morphisms. The field color of each object and the connections between objects are going to be determined in a random way.
      Parameters:
      objNumber - total number of objects the category contains
      numberOfConnections - total number of morphisms that start from each object
      Throws:
      InvalidColorException - If the RGB values provided to the Color's constructor do not fall within the allowed range (0-1).

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string displaying each value of the RGB and YUV triple of the field color of each object of Colors' field objectList and of each source and target object of each morphism of Colors' field morphList one by one.  Every value is preceded by the component's name followed by a colon.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string displaying each value of the RGB and YUV triple of the field color of each object of Colors' field objectList and of each source and target object of each morphism of Color's field morphList one by one.

    • printDEBUG

      public void printDEBUG()
      Prints a string displaying each value of the RGB and YUV triple of the field color of each object of Colors' field objectList, and the identification number of the source and target and a string displaying each value of the RGB and YUV triple of the average color field of each morphism of Colors' field morphList one by one (the values are encapsulated in square brackets and separated by commas).

    • saveToFile

      public void saveToFile​(String path)
      Writes in a new line of the file to be saved in the path specified:
      • for every object of Colors' field objectArray: a string displaying each value of the RGB and YUV triple of the field color. 
      • for every morphism of Colors' field morphArray: the identification number of the source and target and a string displaying each value of the RGB and YUV triple of the average color field. 
      The values are encapsulated in square brackets and separated by commas.
      Parameters:
      path - the path where you want to save the category file
